item.title: Leah add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Whatever you are, be a good one." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Leah add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "Stay gold, Ponyboy, stay gold." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Leah add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "I wanted you to see what real courage is, instead of getting the idea that courage is a man with a gun in his hand. It's when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what. - Atticus Finch" -- Harper Lee

item.title: Leah add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Stephenie Meyer: Her vampires are sparkly, which I think we can all agree is wrong." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Leah add a quote by Alberto Manguel
item.description: "Every reader exists to ensure for a certain book a modest immortality. Reading is, in this sense, a ritual of rebirth." -- Alberto Manguel

item.title: Leah add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I believe a strong woman may be stronger than a man, particularly if she happens to have love in her heart. I guess a loving woman is indestructible." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Leah add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It seems to me that if you or I must choose between two courses of thought or action, we should remember our dying and try so to live that our death brings no pleasure to the world." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Leah add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "A man so painfully in love is capable of self-torture beyond belief." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Leah add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "And now that you don't have to be perfect, you can be good." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Leah add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "My imagination will get me a passport to hell one day." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Leah add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "But I have a new love for that glittering instrument, the human soul. It is a lovely and unique thing in the universe. It is always attacked and never destroyed - because 'Thou mayest." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Leah add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "When a man says he does not want to speak of something he usually means he can think of nothing else." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Leah add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "When you're a child you're the center of everything. Everything happens for you. Other people? They're only ghosts furnished for you to talk to." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Leah add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.
So the America I loved still exists, if not in the White House or the Supreme Court or the Senate or the House of Representatives or the media. The America I love still exists at the front desks of our public libraries." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Leah add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Everything was beautiful and nothing hurt." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Leah add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Here is a lesson in creative writing. First rule: Do not use semicolons. They are transvestite hermaphrodites representing absolutely nothing. All they do is show you've been to college." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Leah add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Leah add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Leah add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The universe is a big place, perhaps the biggest." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Leah add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "One of the few good things about modern times: If you die horribly on television, you will not have died in vain. You will have entertained us." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Leah add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Of all the words of mice and men, the saddest are, "It might have been." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Leah add a quote by kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "As for literary criticism in general: I have long felt that any reviewer who expresses rage and loathing for a novel or a play or a poem is preposterous. He or she is like a person who has put on full armor and attacked a hot fudge sundae or a banana split." -- kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Leah add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The last thing I ever wanted was to be alive when the three most powerful people on the whole planet would be named Bush, Dick and Colon." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Leah add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What I say is, a town isn't a town without a bookstore. It may call itself a town, but unless it's got a bookstore it knows it's not fooling a soul." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Leah add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "I have a passion for teaching kids to become readers, to become comfortable with a book, not daunted. Books shouldn't be daunting, they should be funny, exciting and wonderful; and learning to be a reader gives a terrific advantage." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Leah add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Leah add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places. Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Leah add a quote by Evelyn Waugh
item.description: "It doesn't matter what people call you unless they call you pigeon pie and eat you up." -- Evelyn Waugh
